greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of numbers m such that prime(n) = m + (digit sum of m).
comment: a(n) <= 2 for n <= 10^5. Conjecture: sequence is bounded.

I would rather conjecture the opposite. Of course a(n) >= m implies n >= A006064(m), having more than A230857(m) digits, i.e., 14, 25 and 1111111111125 digits of n, for a(n) = 3, 4, 5. - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 09 2018
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: a107740 n = length [() | let p = a000040 n,
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 23 2005
